Welcome to the latest edition of the Haxe Roundup. Haxe is a high level, strictly typed programming language and cross-compiler.

Haxe US Summit 2019 Wrap-up

  • You can find the complete video collection of the Haxe US Summit 2019 on YouTube. Each talk has a link to its slides, if available.
  • Slides for the talks at Haxe Summit US 2019:
    • Haxe 4: What‚Äôs New - Aleksandr Kuzmenko.
    • Declarative UI Programming - Juraj Kirchheim and GitHub repo.
    • XhX: 10 Years of Haxe - Hugh Sanderson. Checkout Beestly a Windows app that automatically counts brood cells in images of honey bee frames.
    • Audio Development with Haxe - Thomas J Webb notes and slides.
    • Building Giffon with Serverless and Haxe - Andy Li.
    • Feathers UI - Josh Tynjala.
    • Scaling Well With Others - Adam Breece.
    • Titan: Macro-powered FFI for LuaJIT - Justin Donaldson.
  • GitHub repo for cancelled Haxe intro workshop by Andy Li. It was cancelled because all the attendees were beyond beginner level, so they preferred the macros workshop instead.
  • A bunch of photos from Haxe Summit US 2019:
    • Setting up!
    • Progress!
    • Time to go!
    • Alex Kuzmenko on the stage.
    • Justin Donaldson talking about Titan.
    • Juraj Kirchheim talking about Declarative UI Programming.
    • Hugh Sanderson did a AI/ML frontend with the Haxe C++ target with ease.
    • Joshua Granick is about to start us off with what‚Äôs new in OpenFL.
    • Thomas J Webb on audio development with Haxe.
    • Randy will talk about forGL.
    • Andy Li speaking about Serverless, Haxe, and Giffon.io.
    • Kicking off our last day with Juraj Kirchheim on Macros.
    • David and Alex talking about their cardio software.
    • FeathersUI ported to Haxe running in HTML/JS.
    • Join the swag exchange!

Job Offers & Bounties

  • Haxe developers wanted in Montreal to join Mino Games.
  • Julie Games are looking for a Haxe/C# programmer to join their team in Moscow, Russia.
  • Playtika are looking for a Haxe programmer to work at their Minsk branch (Belarus). They are maintaining a Html5 version of their C# game engine, so required skills are: C#, Haxe, Javascript & WebGL. Please contact Ed Ryzhov for details.
  • The Proletariat Inc team is growing. They are looking for artists, engineers and strong community people. Apply Here!
  • Sigma Software have updated their job post and now they are looking for a Senior Haxe Developer.
  • CODEFATHER company (Moscow, Russia) is looking for JavaScript/Haxe programmer who will work on extending game engine built with Pixi.js/Haxe.
  • Shiro Games are looking for a Game Designer and a Senior Game Programmer to join them.
  • Lars Doucet‚Äôs latest bounty for $250 is if you can come up with a nice way to unify HXCPP and HashLink C bindings.
  • Lars Doucet‚Äôs list of various open bounties.
  • Add an available job involving Haxe.

Framework Updates

  • [haxe-concurrent] Haxe-Concurrent v2.1.1 has been released.
  • [checkstyle] Eval threads merged.
  • [json2object] Single-line docs are eaten issue.
  • [craxe] New anonymous support, initial dynamic support and haxe.Json merged.

People & Projects to support

  • Robert Konrad, the Kha author, is creating Programming Toolkits.
  • Lubos & contributors are creating Armory, an open source 3D game engine in Blender.
  • OpenFL is creating free open source software.
  • HaxeUI is creating an open source user interface libraries.
  • HaxeFlixel is creating an open source, cross platform 2D game engine.
  • Slava Ra is creating improvements for FlashDevelop and HaxeDevelop.
  • Mark Knol is working on Haxe and its documentation.
  • Dan Korostelev is working on the Haxe compiler.
  • Lewis Lepton is creating tutorials, code and videos.
  • Eric Bishton is creating the Haxe plugin for IntelliJ IDEA.
  • Will Blanton is creating HaxeFlixel tutorials.
  • Matthew Wallace is creating Haxe By Example tutorials.
  • August Late is creating unique 2D lighting tech.

Updates from the Haxe core

Current Proposals & Discussions

  • Add new Sys API‚Äôs proposal.
  • [RFC] Block Strings discussion.
  • Add support for default type parameters proposal.
  • Add polymorphic this types proposal.
  • Add Type parameter variance for Enums.
  • Add Default values for enum parameters.
  • Do you have an idea to improve Haxe? Consider creating a proposal.

Core Changes

71~ commits have been made to Haxe compiler in the last week.

  • [cs] Add support for native cs type parameter constraints pull request.
  • Fix @:using for interfaces and abstracts merged.
  • Restrict @:allow(some.pack) to types located in the package only merged.
  • Add the haxe define pull request.
  • [matcher] Fixed position of matched enum arguments merged.
  • Use namespaced metadata for targets discussion.
  • Fix call-site inlining with type parameters merged.
In case you missed it
  • [hxcpp] Improve build times, linear instead of quadratic, relative to the number of files pull request.
  • Add target.unicode define merged.
  • Binary format for eval? discussion.
  • [crypto] Add SCrypt and RC4 (ARC4) algorithms 0.3.0 release.
  • Better error messages for \x and \u merged.
  • Disallow \xNN for values higher than 127 fixed.
  • Add jvm alternative output for the java target merged.
  • [java] Add Java 8 classes merged.
  • haxe.Utf8 pull request.
  • Disallow UTF-16 surrogates in Strings merged.
  • Unicode sys tests pull request.

You can get started using the latest features by downloading a nightly build of Haxe.

Take it easy everyone and have a good week!
